poem:
### Storm Bert

Rivers claimed  
the streets—abandoned  
boulevards

the rain's  
spittle upon  
bricks and souls

wretched,  
homes weeping  
in silent chorus

wind dances  
a wild orchestrator,  
plotting escape, 

breathless,  
life's fragile thread  
quivers, yet persists.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "People across the UK: have you been affected by flooding? More than 200 flood alerts remain in England and Wales after torrential downpours from Storm Bert caused “devastating” flooding over the weekend and a major incident in Wales. Hundreds of homes were flooded, with roads turned into rivers and winds of up to 82mph recorded across parts of the UK. At least five deaths have been reported in England and Wales since the storm hit.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
